poem:
**Alan in Crisis**

Alan, unscripted and adrift,  
grapples with the uncontrollable.  
A universe spun by happenstance,  
echoes with wry disbelief.  
Locked out yet looking in,  
he stitches humor from chaos,  
the lens a mirror of calamity,  
questioning with earnest absurdity,  
"Are you well?" when no one quite is,  
a laugh in the storm, an anchor unmoored.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How Are You? It’s Alan (Partridge) review – nothing else on TV has this many laugh-out-loud moments Alan Partridge is in crisis! But then, who isn’t these days? Last time he was on television, Alan was melting down live on air while hosting the light magazine show This Time, ending the series quite literally locked out of the BBC. At the start of his new, self-produced project, the light documentary How Are You? It’s Alan". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
